sub_topic: Finding the inflection points of a function
message_1: A quadratic function f(x) = 2x² - 4x + 3 has an inflection point. Determine the x-coordinate of the inflection point using calculus.
message_2:
Quadratic functions do not have inflection points. An inflection point is a point on the graph of a function where the concavity changes. Quadratic functions have a single, constant concavity, either upward or downward, depending on the sign of the leading coefficient.

In the case of the given function f(x) = 2x² - 4x + 3, the leading coefficient is positive (2), so the graph is a parabola opening upward, and it does not have an inflection point.
